purpose: The email invites submissions for three workshops co-located with the 26th International Conference on Product-Focused Software Process Improvement (PROFES 2025) in Salerno, Italy, on December 1, 2025. The workshops are QuEMaLeS 2025, PATH 2025, and A-SPPI 2025, focusing on quality evaluation of machine learning software systems, advanced technology in healthcare, and software analytics, respectively. It provides important dates for submissions, notifications, and camera-ready submissions, along with detailed descriptions of each workshop's topics of interest and paper formats. The email emphasizes the need for original submissions that adhere to specific formatting guidelines and mentions that accepted papers will be published in a proceedings volume.

conf_name_candidates.raw: QuEMaLeS 2025 – Workshop on Quality Evaluation of Machine Learning Software Systems
conf_name_candidates.evidence: co-located with the 26th International Conference on Product-Focused Software Process Improvement (PROFES 2025), to be held in Salerno, Italy, on December 1, 2025: - QuEMaLeS 2025 – Workshop on Quality Evaluation of Machine Learning Software Systems

conf_name_candidates.raw: PATH 2025 – Promoting and Dealing with Advanced Technology in Healthcare
conf_name_candidates.evidence: - PATH 2025 – Promoting and Dealing with Advanced Technology in Healthcare

conf_name_candidates.raw: A-SPPI 2025 – International Workshop on Analytics for Software Product and Process Improvement
conf_name_candidates.evidence: - A-SPPI 2025 – International Workshop on Analytics for Software Product and Process Improvement

evidence_sentences: We are pleased to invite submissions to the following three workshops, co-located with the 26th International Conference on Product-Focused Software Process Improvement (PROFES 2025), to be held in Salerno, Italy, on December 1, 2025.

These workshops provide forums for researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to present and discuss recent advancements and challenges in software engineering and its intersection with machine learning, healthcare technologies, and software analytics.
All submissions must be in English, original, and not under review or published elsewhere.
Papers must conform to the Springer LNCS formatting guidelines.
Accepted papers will be published in a Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) proceedings volume.
